[PUNCTUATION]: Inconsistent punctuation in the opening poem
[SPELLING]: Inconsistent capitalization of proper nouns (e.g., "Nacogdoches," "Tejas," "De Soto")
Inconsistent spacing in compound names (e.g., "Nuestra Senora" vs "Nuestra Senora")
Inconsistent capitalization of geographic terms (e.g., "Banito," "Angelina river")
Inconsistent capitalization of titles and names (e.g., "Captain Ramon," "Marquis de Aguayo")

[STRUCTURE]: Sudden transition from poetic section to historical narrative without clear connection
[LOGIC]: Abrupt shifts between different historical periods and perspectives
Mixing of mythological and historical accounts without clear delineation
Non-chronological presentation of events in some sections
Shifting between first-person perspective in the poem and third-person historical narrative

[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in "in which that sturdy old Spaniard, Ybarbo, conducted his harassed and bewildered followers"
Complex sentence structure in "The eastern boundary of Texas was at that time a shadowy, uncertain quantity..."
[LEXICON]: Unusual phrase "shadowy, uncertain quantity" could be clearer

[STRUCTURE]: Sudden shift between chapters without transitional sentences
[LOGIC]: Jump from Ybarbo's governance to Philip Nolan's expedition feels abrupt
[TRANSITION]: Weak connection between final sentence of first chapter and opening of second chapter
